title: We’re building a movement to help make Leeds a zero waste city by 2030

intro.title: We’re building a zero waste movement
intro.description:
We’re responding to the climate emergency by exploring how we can waste less and reuse and recycle more in our city. We’re starting conversations, listening to and sharing people’s ideas, and testing new solutions.

 We’re currently working on two main projects:  **Plastic Pioneers & Zero Waste Fashion**.

projects.title: Plastic Pioneers
projects.description:
We’re working on a ground-breaking project empowering schools to break away from single use plastic.  Cardinal Heenan Catholic High School is one of 12 trail blazing schools already signed up.  

Want to join us?

projects.title: Zero Waste Fashion
projects.description:
Fast fashion is on the rise and causing great harm to the environment.  We’ve teamed up with the School of Design at University of Leeds and Leeds City Council to look at practical ways to reduce the impact in our city.  

Interested? Join our Fashion Hack.

hire.title:
Need help? 
 Hire us!
hire.description:
We know there are lots of organisations in Leeds who want to reduce their waste or help the people they work with reduce theirs.

That’s something we can help with. We support businesses, event organisers, schools and communities on their zero waste journey.

join.title: Join our movement
join.description: Every step of our journey we’re uncovering more people in Leeds who are curious, serious or passionate about reducing their waste. If you’re one of those people, join us.
